results.title: Waves and beaches
results.creator_credit: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Geography today: a search for order”.
Examines the relationship between waves and beaches on Spurn head on the north shore of the Humber Estuary. Simulated demonstrations, using time-lapse photography, show the effects of waves and sand in a wave tank. Discusses sediment movement and the effect of different amounts of wave energy on beaches. Simple field experiments examine the factors effecting the size and shape of a beach. Suitable for senior students due to technical language and complex concepts.

results.title: Waverley steps: a visit to Edinburgh
results.creator_credit: John Eldridge, Paul Fletcher and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: A description of Edinburgh, past and present. The film attempts more to convey the atmosphere of the city than to give a straight description of its outstanding features.

results.title: Wave velocities, dispersion and the omega beta diagram (TEFC
results.brief_description: Theodore Van Duger of the University of California, Berkley, shows that a prediction of the action of complex waves can be determined if it is known how its sine wave components propagate along the same system. The film studies the propagation and superposition of complex waves in a barrier system.

results.title: Wave particle duality
results.brief_description: Introduces and discusses the dual nature of light and matter and traces the development of the theory of wave-particle duality. A demonstration showing beams of electrons and neutrons creating a picture of wave motion similar to light’s wave motion is also given.

results.title: Wave and quantum theories
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Light”.
Demonstrates the accepted theory of light as consisting of both wave motion and of discrete bundles or quanta of energy. Performs Young’s double-slit experiment to show the wave character of light. Shows in laboratory demonstrations and in animation the Compton effect and other major experiments associated with the present theory.

results.title: Wave-partical duality
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Traces the development of the various theories advanced to explain the behaviour of light, from the concepts of the ancient Greeks to current proven models. The contributions of Isaac Newtown, Christian Huygens, Thomas Young, Jean Foucault, Albert Einstein and others are outlined as are the reasons for the gradual acceptance of both particle and wave models and their eventual combination. The six 10 minute episodes are: 1. “The Particle model” 2. “The Wave model” 3. “The Electromagnetic model” 4. “The Quantum idea” 5. “Photons” 6. “Matter waves.”

results.title: Watts Library reaches out

results.brief_description: Librarianship is more than just cataloguing and handling books. In the Watts Branch of Los Angeles Public Library, librarians try every avenue to reach and help the community.

results.title: Wattle ballad. No. 1. My old black billy
results.brief_description: The song of the swagman who intends to “stick to me sensible, indispensable, old black billy”, sung by male voices and illustrated by shots of the swagman’s life. Arranged and sung by The Ramblers. Cast features Jock Levy.

results.title: Waters of time
results.brief_description: Produced for the Festival of Britain, this film combines a series of impressions of life along the 69 miles of the Thames from the mouth of the river to Kingston. The camera explores the wharves and warehouses of the waterfront; the docking of a ship; loading and reloading of its cargo; aerial views of the port; busy activity in the holds of the ships; wine cellars in warehouse basements. In the factual passages of the film the commentary is spoken by a dockmaster and docker; in the remainder of the film, the commentary is in prose and verse.
